abstracts.cdata!:
Project ratings are as follows: Project
            outcome is satisfactory; sustainability is likely;
            institutional development impact is substantial; Bank
            performance is satisfactory; and Borrower performance is
            satisfactory. The project has contributed to a number of
            lessons as follows: 1) For the Bank to be effective in a
            conflict/post conflict context, a quick and flexible
            response is required.  2) The demonstration effect of a
            transparent and accountable institution in an environment
            where nothing seems to work has a tremendously positive
            impact on institutional development. FAS evolved into a
            credible institution through its ability to function with
            transparent fiduciary procedures. It set an example of good
            governance for both the public and the private sector. It
            was therefore able to attract significant resources from its
            development partners (donors and private sector). 3)
            Continuity of staffing in a conflict/post conflict context
            helps to deliver goods and services.  4) Developing
            partnerships and enhancing capacity of partners such as
            churches and nongovernmental organizations who provide the
            interface with communities, contributes to identification of
            innovative sub-projects and leveraging of operational costs.
            Training of such partners can ensure consistency in
            community participation tools. 5). The requirement of having
            two women out of five community nucleus members has helped
            to increase female representation, however, the reality of
            this participation needs to be closely monitored and
            supported with training programs. 6) Define social impact
            indicators upfront. To be able to monitor and measure the
            impact of a project on social capital, a clear definition of
            practical indicators (including an appropriate baseline) is required.
